00081 /*===========================================================================
00082  *
00083  *      Func :   R_define_physical_bank() 
00084  *      Desc :   Provides register allocator with description of
00085  *               available processor registers.
00086  *      Input:   see r_regalloc.h
00087  *      Output:  none
00088  *
00089  *      Side Effects: allocates space for all register banks, global <R_bank>
00090  *                    and maps, global <R_map>
00091  *
00092  *===========================================================================*/
00093 
00094 void
00095 R_define_physical_bank_with_rot (int rclass, int type, int num_reg,
00096                                  int reg_size, int overlap,
00097                                  int *reg_array, Set * used,
00098                                  int num_rot_reg, int first_rot_reg,
00099                                  int num_rot_reg_alloc)
00100 {
00101   int i, n_reg, *map, mask;
00102   int overlap_bank = overlap;
00103   R_Physical_Bank *bank = NULL;
00104 
00105   if (R_bank == NULL)
00106     {
00107       R_bank = CALLOC (R_Physical_Bank, R_MAX_BANK);
00108       if (R_bank == NULL)
00109         L_punt ("Register Allocation: unable to allocate register banks");
00110       R_map = CALLOC (int *, R_MAX_BANK);
00111       if (R_map == NULL)
00112         L_punt ("Register Allocation: unable to allocate register maps");
00113     }
00114 
00115   switch (rclass)
00116     {
00117     case R_CALLER:
00118     case R_CALLEE:
00119     case R_MACRO_CALLER:
00120     case R_MACRO_CALLEE:
00121       switch (type)
00122         {
00123           /* make sure the register bank overlaps itself */
00124         case R_PREDICATE:
00125           overlap_bank |= R_OVERLAP_PREDICATE;
00126           break;
00127         case R_INT:
00128           overlap_bank |= R_OVERLAP_INT;
00129           break;
00130         case R_FLOAT:
00131           overlap_bank |= R_OVERLAP_FLOAT;
00132           break;
00133         case R_DOUBLE:
00134           overlap_bank |= R_OVERLAP_DOUBLE;
00135           break;
00136         case R_BTR:
00137           overlap_bank |= R_OVERLAP_BTR;
00138           break;
00139         case R_QUAD:
00140           overlap_bank |= R_OVERLAP_QUAD;
00141           break;
00142         case R_POINTER:
00143           overlap_bank |= R_OVERLAP_POINTER;
00144           break;
00145         default:
00146           L_punt ("Register Allocation: invalid register bank type: %d",
00147                   type);
00148           break;
00149         }
00150       bank = R_bank + rclass + type;
00151       map = R_map[type + rclass];
00152       break;
00153     default:
00154       L_punt ("Register Allocation: invalid register bank rclass: %d",
00155               rclass);
00156       break;
00157     }
00158 
00159   if (used == NULL)
00160     L_punt ("Register Allocation: "
00161             "NULL pointer passed for register usage set!");
00162 
00163   bank->defined = 1;
00164   bank->rclass = rclass;
00165   bank->type = type;
00166   bank->num_reg = num_reg;
00167   bank->num_rot_reg = num_rot_reg;
00168   bank->rot_reg_ofs = first_rot_reg;
00169   bank->num_rot_reg_alloc = num_rot_reg_alloc;
00170   bank->reg_size = reg_size;
00171   bank->overlap = overlap_bank;
00172   bank->used_reg = used;
00173   bank->base_index = 0x7FFFFFFF;
00174 
00175   bank->avail_reg = NULL;
00176   bank->alloc_reg = NULL;
00177 
00178   mask = 0;
00179   for (i = 0; i < reg_size - 1; i++)
00180     mask = mask | 1 << i;
00181   bank->mask = ~mask;
00182 
00183   /* Initialize internal fields, these are redundant in the current impl. */
00184   bank->max = num_reg * reg_size;
00185   bank->res_inc = 1;
00186 
00187   n_reg = bank->num_reg * bank->reg_size;
00188   if (n_reg)
00189     {
00190       map = (int *) malloc (sizeof (int) * n_reg);
00191       for (i = 0; i < n_reg; i++)
00192         map[i] = reg_array[i];
00193     }
00194   else
00195     {
00196       map = NULL;
00197     }
00198 
00199   /* Free any previously existing bank definition */
00200   if (R_map[type + rclass] != NULL)
00201     free (R_map[type + rclass]);
00202 
00203   R_map[type + rclass] = map;
00204 }
00205 
00206 static void
00207 R_invalid_bank_overlap (R_Physical_Bank * bank, int type)
00208 {
00209   fprintf (stdout, "The %s,%s register bank as defined overlaps with\n",
00210            BANK_NAME (bank->type), CLASS_NAME (bank->rclass));
00211   fprintf (stdout, "a %s,%s register bank which does not exist.\n",
00212            BANK_NAME (type), CLASS_NAME (bank->rclass));
00213   fprintf (stdout, "Please examine your register bank definitions.\n");
00214 
00215   exit (-1);
00216 }
00217 
00218 void
00219 R_define_physical_bank (int rclass, int type, int num_reg, int reg_size,
00220                         int overlap, int *reg_array, Set * used)
00221 {
00222   R_define_physical_bank_with_rot (rclass, type, num_reg, reg_size,
00223                                    overlap, reg_array, used, 0, 0, 0);
00224 }
00225 
00226 /*===========================================================================
00227  *
00228  *      Func :  R_analyze_bank_overlap()
00229  *      Desc :  Analyzes the defined register banks and assigns overlap
00230  *              indices based on the overlap information provided
00231  *      Input:  
00232  *      Output: 
00233  *      Side Effects: assigns values to <base_index> for each register bank
00234  *
00235  *      Added loads_per_cycle parameter to eliminate call-back to
00236  *      old scheduler. -JCG 6/99
00237  *===========================================================================*/
00238 void
00239 R_analyze_bank_overlap (void)
00240 {
00241   int i, j, base_index = 0, max_size;
00242   R_Physical_Bank *bank, *overlap_bank;
00243   Stack *stack;
00244 
00245   /* Reset register bank stacks and base indices */
00246   for (i = 0; i < R_MAX_BANK; i++)
00247     {
00248       bank = R_bank + i;
00249       bank->base_index = 0x7FFFFFFF;
00250       Clear_Stack (bank->alloc_reg);
00251       Clear_Stack (bank->avail_reg);
00252       bank->alloc_reg = NULL;
00253       bank->avail_reg = NULL;
00254       for (j = 0; j < R_NUM_TYPES; j++)
00255         bank->overlap_cnt[j] = 0;
00256       R_global_overlap[i] = 0;
00257       R_max_overlap_size[i] = 0;
00258     }
00259 
00260   for (i = 0; i < R_MAX_BANK; i++)
00261     {
00262       bank = R_bank + i;
00263 
00264       if (!bank->defined)
00265         continue;
00266 
00267       if (bank->type == R_INT)
00268         R_global_overlap[R_INT] |= bank->overlap;
00269       else if (bank->type == R_DOUBLE)
00270         R_global_overlap[R_DOUBLE] |= bank->overlap;
00271       else if (bank->type == R_FLOAT)
00272         R_global_overlap[R_FLOAT] |= bank->overlap;
00273       else if (bank->type == R_PREDICATE)
00274         R_global_overlap[R_PREDICATE] |= bank->overlap;
00275       else if (bank->type == R_BTR)
00276         R_global_overlap[R_BTR] |= bank->overlap;
00277       else if (bank->type == R_QUAD)
00278         R_global_overlap[R_QUAD] |= bank->overlap;
00279       else if (bank->type == R_POINTER)
00280         R_global_overlap[R_POINTER] |= bank->overlap;
00281 
00282       max_size = bank->reg_size;
00283 
00284       bank->base_index = base_index;
00285 
00286       if ((bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_PREDICATE) &&
00287           (bank->type != R_PREDICATE))
00288         {
00289           overlap_bank = R_bank + R_PREDICATE + bank->rclass;
00290           if (!overlap_bank->defined)
00291             R_invalid_bank_overlap (bank, R_PREDICATE);
00292 
00293           if (overlap_bank->base_index < bank->base_index)
00294             bank->base_index = overlap_bank->base_index;
00295 
00296           bank->overlap_cnt[R_PREDICATE / R_TYPE_INC] =
00297             R_MAX (bank->reg_size / overlap_bank->reg_size, 1);
00298 
00299           if (overlap_bank->reg_size > max_size)
00300             max_size = overlap_bank->reg_size;
00301         }
00302       if ((bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_INT) && (bank->type != R_INT))
00303         {
00304           overlap_bank = R_bank + R_INT + bank->rclass;
00305           if (!overlap_bank->defined)
00306             R_invalid_bank_overlap (bank, R_INT);
00307 
00308           if (overlap_bank->base_index < bank->base_index)
00309             bank->base_index = overlap_bank->base_index;
00310 
00311           bank->overlap_cnt[R_INT / R_TYPE_INC] =
00312             R_MAX (bank->reg_size / overlap_bank->reg_size, 1);
00313 
00314           if (overlap_bank->reg_size > max_size)
00315             max_size = overlap_bank->reg_size;
00316         }
00317       if ((bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_FLOAT) && (bank->type != R_FLOAT))
00318         {
00319           overlap_bank = R_bank + R_FLOAT + bank->rclass;
00320           if (!overlap_bank->defined)
00321             R_invalid_bank_overlap (bank, R_FLOAT);
00322 
00323           if (overlap_bank->base_index < bank->base_index)
00324             bank->base_index = overlap_bank->base_index;
00325 
00326           bank->overlap_cnt[R_FLOAT / R_TYPE_INC] =
00327             R_MAX (bank->reg_size / overlap_bank->reg_size, 1);
00328 
00329           if (overlap_bank->reg_size > max_size)
00330             max_size = overlap_bank->reg_size;
00331         }
00332       if ((bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_DOUBLE) && (bank->type != R_DOUBLE))
00333         {
00334           overlap_bank = R_bank + R_DOUBLE + bank->rclass;
00335           if (!overlap_bank->defined)
00336             R_invalid_bank_overlap (bank, R_DOUBLE);
00337 
00338           if (overlap_bank->base_index < bank->base_index)
00339             bank->base_index = overlap_bank->base_index;
00340 
00341           bank->overlap_cnt[R_DOUBLE / R_TYPE_INC] =
00342             R_MAX (bank->reg_size / overlap_bank->reg_size, 1);
00343 
00344           if (overlap_bank->reg_size > max_size)
00345             max_size = overlap_bank->reg_size;
00346         }
00347       if ((bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_BTR) && (bank->type != R_BTR))
00348         {
00349           overlap_bank = R_bank + R_BTR + bank->rclass;
00350           if (!overlap_bank->defined)
00351             R_invalid_bank_overlap (bank, R_BTR);
00352 
00353           if (overlap_bank->base_index < bank->base_index)
00354             bank->base_index = overlap_bank->base_index;
00355 
00356           bank->overlap_cnt[R_BTR / R_TYPE_INC] =
00357             R_MAX (bank->reg_size / overlap_bank->reg_size, 1);
00358 
00359           if (overlap_bank->reg_size > max_size)
00360             max_size = overlap_bank->reg_size;
00361         }
00362       if ((bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_QUAD) && (bank->type != R_QUAD))
00363         {
00364           overlap_bank = R_bank + R_QUAD + bank->rclass;
00365           if (!overlap_bank->defined)
00366             R_invalid_bank_overlap (bank, R_QUAD);
00367 
00368           if (overlap_bank->base_index < bank->base_index)
00369             bank->base_index = overlap_bank->base_index;
00370 
00371           bank->overlap_cnt[R_QUAD / R_TYPE_INC] =
00372             R_MAX (bank->reg_size / overlap_bank->reg_size, 1);
00373 
00374           if (overlap_bank->reg_size > max_size)
00375             max_size = overlap_bank->reg_size;
00376         }
00377       if ((bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_POINTER) && (bank->type != R_POINTER))
00378         {
00379           overlap_bank = R_bank + R_POINTER + bank->rclass;
00380           if (!overlap_bank->defined)
00381             R_invalid_bank_overlap (bank, R_POINTER);
00382 
00383           if (overlap_bank->base_index < bank->base_index)
00384             bank->base_index = overlap_bank->base_index;
00385 
00386           bank->overlap_cnt[R_POINTER / R_TYPE_INC] =
00387             R_MAX (bank->reg_size / overlap_bank->reg_size, 1);
00388 
00389           if (overlap_bank->reg_size > max_size)
00390             max_size = overlap_bank->reg_size;
00391         }
00392 
00393       /* No overlapping banks were found with smaller base_index, */
00394       /* so increment the base index past the current bank       */
00395       if (bank->base_index == base_index)
00396         {
00397           base_index += bank->num_reg * bank->reg_size;
00398           /* ensure that base_index is always even */
00399           if (base_index & 0x1)
00400             base_index += 1;
00401         }
00402 
00403       if (R_max_overlap_size[bank->type] < max_size)
00404         R_max_overlap_size[bank->type] = max_size;
00405 
00406       /* Initialize amount for <alloc_reg> stack initialization */
00407       bank->alloc_init = (max_size / bank->reg_size) * (mdes_total_slots ());
00408       /* Currently assume uniform -JCG 6/99 */
00409 
00410       /* Initialize the available register stack for the bank */
00411       stack = New_Stack ();
00412       for (j = bank->base_index;
00413            j < bank->base_index + bank->num_reg * bank->reg_size;
00414            j += bank->reg_size)
00415         Push_Bot (stack, (void *)(long int) j);
00416 
00417       if (M_arch != M_X86 || (R_Round_Robin_Allocation == 1))
00418         {
00419           bank->avail_reg = stack;
00420           bank->alloc_reg = New_Stack ();
00421         }
00422       else
00423         {
00424           /* Since we are allocating an X86 architecture, don't bother */
00425           /* to try to spread the register usage.  Place all registers */
00426           /* on the alloc stack.                                       */
00427           bank->avail_reg = New_Stack ();
00428           bank->alloc_reg = stack;
00429         }
00430     }
00431 }
00432 
00433 void
00434 R_reset_register_stacks (void)
00435 {
00436   int i, j;
00437   R_Physical_Bank *bank;
00438   Stack *stack;
00439 
00440   for (i = 0; i < R_MAX_BANK; i++)
00441     {
00442       bank = R_bank + i;
00443 
00444       if (!bank->defined)
00445         continue;
00446 
00447       Clear_Stack (bank->alloc_reg);
00448       Clear_Stack (bank->avail_reg);
00449 
00450       /* 
00451        * If the stack is not empty, reinitialize it.  None empty
00452        * stacks are those overlapping with banks that have been
00453        * previously reinitialized
00454        */
00455 
00456       stack = bank->avail_reg;
00457       for (j = bank->base_index;
00458            j < bank->base_index + bank->num_reg * bank->reg_size;
00459            j += bank->reg_size)
00460         Push_Bot (stack, (void *)(long int) j);
00461     }
00462 }
00463 
00464 /*===========================================================================
00465  *
00466  *      Func :  R_find_free_register()
00467  *      Desc :  Searchs for a free register for the given live range based on
00468  *              its type and rclass. In the following order:
00469  *              Ex: type = INT, rclass = CALLER.
00470  *                  1) INT,MACRO_CALLER
00471  *                  2) INT,CALLER
00472  *                  3) INT,MACRO_CALLEE 
00473  *                  4) INT,CALLEE
00474  *      Input:  Node node               - current live range 
00475  *              Set reserved_resource   - unavailable registers
00476  *      Output: Available register or -1 if none 
00477  *
00478  *      Side Effects:  none 
00479  *
00480  *===========================================================================*/
00481 int
00482 R_find_free_register_in_bank (R_Physical_Bank * reg_bank,
00483                               Set reserved_resource, R_Reg * vreg)
00484 {
00485   int j, k, ok, res, reg, res_inc, res_max;
00486   int *overlap_cnt, overlap_reg;
00487   Stack *alloc_reg, *avail_reg;
00488   StackElmt *stack_reg, *ptr, *next;
00489   int arch = M_arch;
00490 #if 0
00491   int null, dbl_num;
00492 #endif
00493 
00494   ok = 0;
00495 
00496   /* X86 flag to selectively activate round robin allocation. */
00497   if (R_Round_Robin_Allocation == 1)
00498     arch = -1;
00499 
00500 #if 0
00501   fprintf (stdout, "\n**%s,%s bank:\n", BANK_NAME (reg_bank->type),
00502            CLASS_NAME (reg_bank->rclass));
00503   fprintf (stdout, "alloc:\n");
00504   Stack_Print (reg_bank->alloc_reg);
00505   fprintf (stdout, "\navail:\n");
00506   Stack_Print (reg_bank->avail_reg);
00507   fprintf (stdout, "**\n");
00508 #endif
00509 
00510   res_inc = reg_bank->res_inc;
00511   res_max = reg_bank->res_inc * reg_bank->reg_size;
00512 
00513   alloc_reg = reg_bank->alloc_reg;
00514   avail_reg = reg_bank->avail_reg;
00515   overlap_cnt = reg_bank->overlap_cnt;
00516   /* 
00517    * Determine if there is an available register in the 
00518    * stack of already allocated registers, i.e. attempt
00519    * to minimize register usage
00520    */
00521   stack_reg = Stack_Ptr_Reset (alloc_reg);
00522   while ((stack_reg != NULL) && (vreg->rotating == 0))
00523     {
00524       ok = 1;
00525       reg = (int)(long int) Stack_Elmt_Data (stack_reg);
00526 
00527       for (res = reg; res < reg + res_max; res += res_inc)
00528         {
00529           if (Set_in (reserved_resource, res))
00530             {
00531               ok = 0;
00532               break;
00533             }
00534         }
00535       if (ok)
00536         {
00537 #if 0
00538           fprintf (stdout, "-> %d is available.\n", reg);
00539 #endif
00540           /* If the we are allocating for an x86 architecture, don't */
00541           /* round robin the registers on the alloc stack.  The arch */
00542           /* doesn't have enough registers to try to minimize the    */
00543           /* impact of register allocation to postpass scheduling.   */
00544           /* All registers are placed on the alloc stack.            */
00545           if (arch == M_X86)
00546             return (reg);
00547           /*
00548            *  If a previously allocated register is available  
00549            *  place it on the bottom of the stack to minimize
00550            *  unnecessary reuse of registers.
00551            */
00552 /*
00553             if ( Stack_Is_Bottom(alloc_reg) )
00554                 fprintf(stdout,"\tBOTTOM ELEMENT\n");
00555                 */
00556           Delete_Stack (alloc_reg, stack_reg);
00557           Push_Bot (alloc_reg, (void *)(long int) reg);
00558 #if 0
00559           fprintf (stdout, "alloc after:\n");
00560           Stack_Print (reg_bank->alloc_reg);
00561           fprintf (stdout, "\n");
00562 #endif
00563           /*
00564            *  Update the stacks of overlapping register banks
00565            *  to reflect the change in the current stack 
00566            */
00567           for (j = 0; j < R_NUM_TYPES; j++)
00568             {
00569               int cnt, mask, overlap_size;
00570               Stack *overlap_alloc;
00571               R_Physical_Bank *overlap_bank;
00572 
00573               if ((cnt = overlap_cnt[j]))
00574                 {
00575                   overlap_bank = R_bank + (j * R_TYPE_INC) + reg_bank->rclass;
00576                   overlap_alloc = overlap_bank->alloc_reg;
00577                   overlap_size = overlap_bank->reg_size;
00578 
00579 #if 0
00580                   fprintf (stdout, "-> adjusting overlapping bank\n");
00581                   fprintf (stdout, "-> %s,%s bank:\n",
00582                            BANK_NAME (overlap_bank->type),
00583                            CLASS_NAME (overlap_bank->rclass));
00584                   fprintf (stdout, "before\n");
00585                   Stack_Print (overlap_bank->alloc_reg);
00586 #endif
00587 
00588                   ptr = Stack_Ptr_Reset (overlap_alloc);
00589 
00590                   /* The overlapping register bank contains larger registers */
00591                   /* than the current bank, so compare the register to be    */
00592                   /* moved is the register in the overlapping stack that is  */
00593                   /* equal to < reg & overlap_bank->mask >                   */
00594                   if (reg_bank->reg_size < overlap_size)
00595                     {
00596                       mask = overlap_bank->mask;
00597                       while (cnt && ptr)
00598                         {
00599                           overlap_reg = (int)(long int) Stack_Elmt_Data (ptr);
00600                           next = Stack_Find_Next (overlap_alloc);
00601                           if ((reg & mask) == overlap_reg)
00602                             {
00603                               Delete_Stack (overlap_alloc, ptr);
00604                               Push_Bot (overlap_alloc, 
00605                                         (void *)(long int) overlap_reg);
00606                               cnt--;
00607                             }
00608                           ptr = next;
00609                         }
00610                     }
00611                   /* The overlapping register bank contains smaller
00612                      registers than the current bank, so the registers
00613                      to be moved are those where < overlap_reg &
00614                      reg_bank->mask > is equal to the current register */
00615                   else
00616                     {
00617                       mask = reg_bank->mask;
00618                       while (cnt && ptr)
00619                         {
00620                           overlap_reg = (int)(long int) Stack_Elmt_Data (ptr);
00621                           next = Stack_Find_Next (overlap_alloc);
00622                           if ((overlap_reg & mask) == reg)
00623                             {
00624                               Delete_Stack (overlap_alloc, ptr);
00625                               Push_Bot (overlap_alloc, 
00626                                         (void *)(long int) overlap_reg);
00627                               cnt--;
00628                             }
00629                           ptr = next;
00630                         }
00631                     }
00632 
00633 #if 0
00634                   fprintf (stdout, "\nafter\n");
00635                   Stack_Print (overlap_bank->alloc_reg);
00636                   fprintf (stdout, "\n");
00637 #endif
00638                 }
00639             }
00640           return (reg);
00641         }
00642       /*
00643        * Find the next register on the allocated register stack to
00644        * see if it is available
00645        */
00646       stack_reg = Stack_Find_Next (alloc_reg);
00647     }
00648 
00649   /*
00650    * Since we've made it this far, none of the previously allocated
00651    * registers are free, so grab registers off of the available
00652    * register stack until we find one that we can use.  In most
00653    * cases, the first one will be available, the exception to this
00654    * is macroregisters.
00655    */
00656   reg = 0;
00657 
00658 #if 0
00659   R_get_rot_regs (L_fn, &null, &null, &null, &null,
00660                   &null, &dbl_num, &null, &null);
00661 #endif
00662   
00663   while (reg != -1)
00664     {
00665       /*
00666        * Move registers from the available register stack to
00667        * the allocated register stack in increments of <alloc_init>
00668        * checking each one to see if it is usable
00669        */
00670 
00671       if (vreg->rotating == 1)
00672         {
00673           int nth_rot_reg = vreg->nth_rot_reg;
00674           int overlap_offset = 0;
00675 
00676           if (vreg->type == R_FLOAT)
00677             {
00678 #if 0
00679               /* The overlap_offset allocates the floats as
00680                  higher numbered registers immediately following
00681                  the doubles in the shared register file.  This is
00682                  currently a quick-fix and should be set
00683                  automatically in the analyze_overlap
00684                  functions. MCM */
00685               overlap_offset = dbl_num;
00686 #else
00687               L_punt("Shouldn't find a FLOAT. MCM");
00688 #endif
00689             }
00690           
00691           /* nth_rot_reg is the n-th register from the beginning of
00692              the rotating register set. Reg_size is relative to the
00693              base register size for overlapped registers.  For
00694              example, doubles are size 2 while floats are size 1
00695              when overlapped for HPPA.  ints are size 1 for IMPACT
00696              and HPPA because there are no sub-register sizes.  On
00697              x86, I am not sure about the sizes for accesses to eax
00698              vs ah. MCM */
00699 
00700           reg = (nth_rot_reg * reg_bank->reg_size) + overlap_offset
00701             + reg_bank->rot_reg_ofs + reg_bank->base_index;
00702 
00703           if ((reg_bank->base_index + reg_bank->rot_reg_ofs) > reg ||
00704               (reg_bank->base_index + reg_bank->rot_reg_ofs
00705                + (reg_bank->num_rot_reg * reg_bank->reg_size)) <= reg)
00706             {
00707               return (-1);
00708             }
00709 
00710           stack_reg = Stack_Find (avail_reg, (void *)(long int) reg);
00711 
00712           if (stack_reg == NULL || Set_in (reserved_resource, reg))
00713             {
00714               L_punt ("R_find_free_register_in_bank: rot reg unavailable.");
00715             }
00716           reg = (int)(long int) Stack_Elmt_Data (stack_reg);
00717           Delete_Stack (avail_reg, stack_reg);
00718           Push_Bot (alloc_reg, (void *)(long int) reg);
00719           ok = 1;
00720         }
00721       else
00722         {
00723           for (j = 0; j < reg_bank->alloc_init; j++)
00724             {
00725               if ((reg = (int)(long int) Stack_Top (avail_reg)) != -1)
00726                 {
00727                   ok = 1;
00728                   for (res = reg; res < reg + res_max; res += res_inc)
00729                     {
00730                       if (Set_in (reserved_resource, res))
00731                         {
00732                           ok = 0;
00733                           break;
00734                         }
00735                     }
00736                   Push_Bot (alloc_reg, Pop (avail_reg));
00737                   if (ok)
00738                     {
00739                       j++;
00740                       break;
00741                     }
00742                 }
00743             }
00744           for (; j < reg_bank->alloc_init; j++)
00745             {
00746               if (((int)(long int) Stack_Top (avail_reg)) != -1)
00747                 Push_Bot (alloc_reg, Pop (avail_reg));
00748             }
00749         }
00750 #if 0
00751       fprintf (stdout, "-> %d off of available register stack.\n", reg);
00752 #endif
00753 
00754       if (vreg->rotating == 1)
00755         {
00756           /*
00757            *  Update the stacks of overlapping register banks
00758            *  to reflect the change in the current stack 
00759            */
00760           for (j = 0; j < R_NUM_TYPES; j++)
00761             {
00762               int cnt, mask, overlap_size;
00763               Stack *overlap_alloc;
00764               Stack *overlap_avail;
00765               R_Physical_Bank *overlap_bank;
00766 
00767               if ((cnt = overlap_cnt[j]))
00768                 {
00769                   overlap_bank = R_bank + (j * R_TYPE_INC) + reg_bank->rclass;
00770                   overlap_avail = overlap_bank->avail_reg;
00771                   overlap_alloc = overlap_bank->alloc_reg;
00772                   overlap_size = overlap_bank->reg_size;
00773 
00774 #if 0
00775                   fprintf (stdout, "-> adjusting overlapping bank\n");
00776                   fprintf (stdout, "-> %s,%s bank:\n",
00777                            BANK_NAME (overlap_bank->type),
00778                            CLASS_NAME (overlap_bank->rclass));
00779                   fprintf (stdout, "before\n");
00780                   Stack_Print (overlap_bank->avail_reg);
00781 #endif
00782 
00783                   ptr = Stack_Ptr_Reset (overlap_avail);
00784 
00785                   /* The overlapping register bank contains larger registers */
00786                   /* than the current bank, so compare the register to be    */
00787                   /* moved is the register in the overlapping stack that is  */
00788                   /* equal to < reg & overlap_bank->mask >                   */
00789                   if (reg_bank->reg_size < overlap_size)
00790                     {
00791                       mask = overlap_bank->mask;
00792                       while (cnt && ptr)
00793                         {
00794                           overlap_reg = (int)(long int) Stack_Elmt_Data (ptr);
00795                           next = Stack_Find_Next (overlap_avail);
00796                           if ((reg & mask) == overlap_reg)
00797                             {
00798                               Delete_Stack (overlap_avail, ptr);
00799                               Push_Bot (overlap_alloc, 
00800                                         (void *)(long int) overlap_reg);
00801                               cnt--;
00802                             }
00803                           ptr = next;
00804                         }
00805                     }
00806                   /* The overlapping register bank contains smaller
00807                      registers than the current bank, so the registers
00808                      to be moved are those where < overlap_reg &
00809                      reg_bank->mask > is equal to the current register */
00810                   else
00811                     {
00812                       mask = reg_bank->mask;
00813                       while (cnt && ptr)
00814                         {
00815                           overlap_reg = (int)(long int) Stack_Elmt_Data (ptr);
00816                           next = Stack_Find_Next (overlap_avail);
00817                           if ((overlap_reg & mask) == reg)
00818                             {
00819                               Delete_Stack (overlap_avail, ptr);
00820                               Push_Bot (overlap_alloc, 
00821                                         (void *)(long int) overlap_reg);
00822                               cnt--;
00823                             }
00824                           ptr = next;
00825                         }
00826                     }
00827                 }
00828             }
00829         }
00830       else
00831         {
00832           /*
00833            * Update the stacks of overlapping register banks
00834            * to reflect the change in the current stack
00835            */
00836           for (j = 0; j < R_NUM_TYPES; j++)
00837             {
00838               int cnt;
00839               Stack *overlap_alloc, *overlap_avail;
00840               R_Physical_Bank *overlap_bank;
00841 
00842               if ((cnt = overlap_cnt[j]))
00843                 {
00844                   int init;
00845 
00846                   overlap_bank = R_bank + (j * R_TYPE_INC) + reg_bank->rclass;
00847                   overlap_alloc = overlap_bank->alloc_reg;
00848                   overlap_avail = overlap_bank->avail_reg;
00849 #if 0
00850                   fprintf (stdout, "-> adjusting overlapping bank\n");
00851                   fprintf (stdout, "-> %s,%s bank:\n",
00852                            BANK_NAME (overlap_bank->type),
00853                            CLASS_NAME (overlap_bank->rclass));
00854                   fprintf (stdout, "before\n");
00855                   Stack_Print (overlap_bank->alloc_reg);
00856 #endif
00857                   init = overlap_bank->alloc_init / cnt;
00858                   for (k = 0; k < init; k++)
00859                     {
00860                       while (cnt)
00861                         {
00862                           if (((int)(long int) Stack_Top (overlap_avail)) 
00863                               != -1)
00864                             Push_Bot (overlap_alloc, Pop (overlap_avail));
00865                           cnt--;
00866                         }
00867                       cnt = overlap_cnt[j];
00868                     }
00869 #if 0
00870                   fprintf (stdout, "\nafter\n");
00871                   Stack_Print (overlap_bank->alloc_reg);
00872                   fprintf (stdout, "\n");
00873 #endif
00874                 }
00875             }
00876         }
00877       if (ok)
00878         return (reg);
00879 
00880       reg = (int)(long int) Stack_Top (avail_reg);
00881     }
00882 
00883   /* At this point, we have found no available register */
00884   return (-1);
00885 }
00886 
00887 
00888 int
00889 R_find_free_register (R_Reg * vreg, Set reserved_resource, int final)
00890 {
00891   int mac_rclass = -1, vreg_rclass;
00892   int res, res_inc, res_max, ok;
00893   R_Physical_Bank *reg_bank;
00894   L_Region_Regmap *regmap;
00895   int free = -2;
00896 
00897   if ((vreg->flags & R_REGION_CONSTRAINED))
00898     {
00899       regmap = L_find_region_regmap (R_Region, vreg->index);
00900       if (regmap != NULL && regmap->phys_reg != -1)
00901         {
00902           reg_bank = R_bank + vreg->type + regmap->type;
00903           res_inc = reg_bank->res_inc;
00904           res_max = reg_bank->res_inc * reg_bank->reg_size;
00905           free = regmap->phys_reg;
00906           ok = 1;
00907           for (res = free; res < free + res_max; res += res_inc)
00908             {
00909               if (Set_in (reserved_resource, res))
00910                 {
00911                   ok = 0;
00912                   /*
00913                      fprintf(stdout,"R_find_free_register: "
00914                                     "can't use global allocation %d -> %d\n",
00915                      vreg->index,regmap->phys_reg);
00916 
00917 
00918                      if ( vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_FLYBY )
00919                      fprintf(stdout,"FLYBY's global is illegal locally\n");
00920                    */
00921                   if (final)
00922                     vreg->flags &= (~(R_REGION_CONSTRAINED));
00923                   return (-1);
00924                 }
00925             }
00926           if (ok)
00927             {
00928               vreg->rclass = regmap->type;
00929               return (regmap->phys_reg);
00930             }
00931         }
00932     }
00933 
00934   if (vreg->rclass == R_PREFER_SPILL)
00935     return (-1);
00936 
00937 #if 0
00938   fprintf (stdout, "*\nvreg %d\n*\n", vreg->index);
00939 #endif
00940 
00941   /* First check to see if we can place the virtual register in */
00942   /* macro register                                             */
00943   if (R_Macro_Allocation)
00944     {
00945       mac_rclass = (vreg->rclass == R_CALLER) ? 
00946         R_MACRO_CALLER : R_MACRO_CALLEE;
00947 
00948       reg_bank = R_bank + vreg->type + mac_rclass;
00949 
00950       if (reg_bank->defined &&
00951           ((free = R_find_free_register_in_bank (reg_bank,
00952                                                  reserved_resource,
00953                                                  vreg)) != -1))
00954         {
00955           vreg->rclass = mac_rclass;
00956           return (free);
00957         }
00958     }
00959   /* Now, check to see if we can place the register in the desired bank */
00960   reg_bank = R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass;
00961   if (reg_bank->defined &&
00962       ((free = R_find_free_register_in_bank (reg_bank,
00963                                              reserved_resource, vreg)) != -1))
00964     {
00965       return (free);
00966     }
00967 
00968   if ((vreg->rclass == R_CALLER) ?
00969       (vreg->callee_benefit >= 0) : (vreg->caller_benefit >= 0))
00970     {
00971       if (R_Macro_Allocation)
00972         {
00973           /* First try to use macro register in other bank */
00974           mac_rclass = (mac_rclass == R_MACRO_CALLER) ? 
00975             R_MACRO_CALLEE : R_MACRO_CALLER;
00976           reg_bank = R_bank + vreg->type + mac_rclass;
00977 
00978           if (reg_bank->defined &&
00979               ((free = R_find_free_register_in_bank (reg_bank,
00980                                                      reserved_resource,
00981                                                      vreg)) != -1))
00982             {
00983               vreg->rclass = mac_rclass;
00984               return (free);
00985             }
00986         }
00987 
00988       /* Now try the other bank since cost is not negative */
00989       vreg_rclass = ((vreg->rclass == R_CALLER) ? R_CALLEE : R_CALLER);
00990       reg_bank = R_bank + vreg->type + vreg_rclass;
00991       if (reg_bank->defined &&
00992           ((free = R_find_free_register_in_bank (reg_bank,
00993                                                  reserved_resource,
00994                                                  vreg)) != -1))
00995         {
00996           vreg->rclass = vreg_rclass;
00997           return (free);
00998         }
00999 
01000       if (free == -2)
01001         {
01002           L_punt ("No register bank defined for registers of type: %s\n",
01003                   BANK_NAME (vreg->type));
01004         }
01005     }
01006   return (-1);
01007 }
01008 
01009 int
01010 R_find_rotating_register (R_Reg * vreg, Set reserved_resource, int final)
01011 {
01012   int vreg_rclass;
01013   R_Physical_Bank *reg_bank;
01014   int free = -2;
01015 
01016 #if 0
01017   fprintf (stdout, "*\nvreg %d\n*\n", vreg->index);
01018 #endif
01019 
01020   reg_bank = O_locate_rot_reg_bank (L_fn, vreg);
01021 
01022   if (reg_bank->defined &&
01023       ((free
01024         =
01025         R_find_free_register_in_bank (reg_bank, reserved_resource,
01026                                       vreg)) != -1))
01027     {
01028       return (free);
01029     }
01030 
01031   /* MCM We should never get here. */
01032   L_punt ("R_find_rotating_register: "
01033           "Unable to allocate register in specified bank.");
01034 
01035   if ((vreg->rclass == R_CALLER) ? (vreg->callee_benefit >= 0) :
01036     (vreg->caller_benefit >= 0))
01037     {
01038       /* Now try the other bank since cost is not negative */
01039       vreg_rclass = ((vreg->rclass == R_CALLER) ? R_CALLEE : R_CALLER);
01040       reg_bank = R_bank + vreg->type + vreg_rclass;
01041       if (reg_bank->defined &&
01042           ((free
01043             =
01044             R_find_free_register_in_bank (reg_bank, reserved_resource,
01045                                           vreg)) != -1))
01046         {
01047           vreg->rclass = vreg_rclass;
01048           return (free);
01049         }
01050       if (free == -2)
01051         {
01052           L_punt ("No register bank defined for registers of type: %s\n",
01053                   BANK_NAME (vreg->type));
01054         }
01055     }
01056   return (-1);
01057 }
01058 
01059 /*===========================================================================
01060  *
01061  *      Func :  R_smallest_overlapping_bank()
01062  *      Desc :  Given a register bank type and rclass, this function determines
01063  *              the register bank of smallest <reg_size> that overlaps
01064  *      Input:  type - register bank type
01065  *              rclass - register bank rclass 
01066  *      Output: register bank type 
01067  *
01068  *      Side Effects: none
01069  *
01070  *===========================================================================*/
01071 int
01072 R_smallest_overlapping_bank (int type, int rclass)
01073 {
01074   R_Physical_Bank *bank;
01075 
01076   bank = R_bank + type + rclass;
01077 
01078   /* This works since R_define_physical_bank ensures that */
01079   /* a register bank overlaps at least itself             */
01080 
01081   if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_PREDICATE)
01082     return (R_PREDICATE);
01083   else if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_INT)
01084     return (R_INT);
01085   else if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_FLOAT)
01086     return (R_FLOAT);
01087   else if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_DOUBLE)
01088     return (R_DOUBLE);
01089   else if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_BTR)
01090     return (R_BTR);
01091   else if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_QUAD)
01092     return (R_QUAD);
01093 
01094   L_punt ("R_smallest_overlapping_bank: "
01095           "no register bank overlap for type: %d\n",
01096           bank->overlap);
01097   return (0);
01098 }
01099 
01100 void
01101 R_print_bank_configuration (void)
01102 {
01103   int i, j, *map, count;
01104   R_Physical_Bank *bank;
01105 
01106   fprintf (stdout, "*\n*\n* Register Bank Configuration\n*\n*\n");
01107 
01108   for (i = 0; i < R_MAX_BANK; i++)
01109     {
01110       bank = R_bank + i;
01111       if (!bank->defined)
01112         continue;
01113 
01114       fprintf (stdout, "Name #%d:\n", i);
01115       fprintf (stdout, "\tType:\t%s\n", BANK_NAME (bank->type));
01116       fprintf (stdout, "\tClass:\t%s\n", CLASS_NAME (bank->rclass));
01117       fprintf (stdout, "\tNumber:\t%d\n", bank->num_reg);
01118       fprintf (stdout, "\tSize:\t%d\n", bank->reg_size);
01119       fprintf (stdout, "\tNumRot:\t%d\n", bank->num_rot_reg);
01120 
01121       /* Overlap conditions */
01122       fprintf (stdout, "\tOverlap:\t");
01123       if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_PREDICATE)
01124         fprintf (stdout, "PREDICATE(%d) ",
01125                  bank->overlap_cnt[R_PREDICATE / R_TYPE_INC]);
01126       if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_INT)
01127         fprintf (stdout, "INT(%d) ", bank->overlap_cnt[R_INT / R_TYPE_INC]);
01128       if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_FLOAT)
01129         fprintf (stdout, "FLOAT(%d) ",
01130                  bank->overlap_cnt[R_FLOAT / R_TYPE_INC]);
01131       if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_DOUBLE)
01132         fprintf (stdout, "DOUBLE(%d) ",
01133                  bank->overlap_cnt[R_DOUBLE / R_TYPE_INC]);
01134       if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_BTR)
01135         fprintf (stdout, "BTR(%d) ", bank->overlap_cnt[R_BTR / R_TYPE_INC]);
01136       if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_QUAD)
01137         fprintf (stdout, "QUAD(%d) ", bank->overlap_cnt[R_QUAD / R_TYPE_INC]);
01138       if (bank->overlap & R_OVERLAP_POINTER)
01139         fprintf (stdout, "POINTER(%d) ",
01140                  bank->overlap_cnt[R_POINTER / R_TYPE_INC]);
01141       fprintf (stdout, "\n");
01142 
01143       /* Register Maps */
01144       fprintf (stdout, "\tMap:\t");
01145 
01146       map = R_map[bank->type + bank->rclass];
01147       count = 0;
01148       for (j = 0; j < bank->num_reg * bank->reg_size; j += bank->reg_size)
01149         {
01150 
01151           if (count == 0)
01152             {
01153               fprintf (stdout, "%d:\t", bank->base_index + j);
01154             }
01155 
01156           if (bank->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLER ||
01157               bank->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLEE)
01158             fprintf (stdout, "%s ", L_macro_name (map[j]));
01159           else
01160             fprintf (stdout, "%d ", map[j]);
01161 
01162           if (count++ == 9)
01163             {
01164               fprintf (stdout, "\n\t\t");
01165               count = 0;
01166             }
01167         }
01168 
01169       if (bank->alloc_reg != NULL)
01170         {
01171           fprintf (stdout, "\n\t\talloc:\n");
01172           Stack_Print (bank->alloc_reg);
01173         }
01174       if (bank->avail_reg != NULL)
01175         {
01176           fprintf (stdout, "\n\t\tavail:\n");
01177           Stack_Print (bank->avail_reg);
01178         }
01179 
01180       fprintf (stdout, "\n\n");
01181     }
01182   fprintf (stdout, "\n");
01183 }
01184 
01185 /*===========================================================================
01186  *
01187  *      Func :  R_virtual_to_machine_conversion()
01188  *      Desc :  Determines the machine register that a live range has been
01189  *              allocated to.  The <base_index> field is then assigned that
01190  *              value.  For code generation purposes, sets of caller and
01191  *              callee saved registers used are also created.
01192  *      Input:  Set *caller     - set of caller saved registers used 
01193  *              Set *callee     - set of callee saved registers used     
01194  *      Output: void 
01195  *
01196  *      Side Effects:  none 
01197  *
01198  *===========================================================================*/
01199 void
01200 R_virtual_to_machine_conversion (void)
01201 {
01202   int *phys_map;
01203   R_Reg *vreg;
01204   R_Physical_Bank *bank;
01205   int int_base, int_num, flt_base, flt_num, dbl_base, dbl_num, pred_base,
01206     pred_num;
01207   L_Attr *rr_attr;
01208 
01209   R_get_rot_regs (L_fn, &int_base, &int_num, &flt_base, &flt_num,
01210                   &dbl_base, &dbl_num, &pred_base, &pred_num);
01211 
01212   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
01213     {
01214       if (vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_FLYBY &&
01215           !(vreg->flags & R_REGION_CONSTRAINED))
01216         continue;
01217 
01218       /* locate physical register corresponding to base_index */
01219       /* assigned to the virtual register during allocation   */
01220       bank = R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass;
01221 
01222       if (!bank->defined)
01223         L_punt ("Register allocated to non-existant register bank!");
01224 
01225       phys_map = R_map[vreg->type + vreg->rclass];
01226 
01227       vreg->phys_reg = phys_map[vreg->base_index - bank->base_index];
01228 
01229       *bank->used_reg = Set_add (*bank->used_reg, vreg->phys_reg);
01230 
01231       if (vreg->rotating == 1)
01232         {
01233           /* This conditional converts the virtual register base ID
01234              of the rotating register segments to their physical register IDs.
01235              Set the base register variables to the negative physical
01236              register base.  This prevents the new physical register base
01237              from later matching a virtual register ID and being set again
01238              to the wrong physical register. */
01239           if (int_base == vreg->index)
01240             int_base = -vreg->phys_reg;
01241           if (flt_base == vreg->index)
01242             flt_base = -vreg->phys_reg;
01243           if (dbl_base == vreg->index)
01244             dbl_base = -vreg->phys_reg;
01245           if (pred_base == vreg->index)
01246             pred_base = -vreg->phys_reg;
01247         }
01248     }
01249 
01250   if (R_Print_Allocation)
01251     {
01252       int count = 32;
01253       fprintf (stderr, "\n***  ALLOCATION RESULTS ***\n\n");
01254 
01255       for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
01256         {
01257           if (vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_FLYBY)
01258             continue;
01259 
01260           if (count == 32)
01261             {
01262               fprintf (stderr,
01263                        "\nVREG\tTYPE\tRESULT\tREGISTER\tCLASS\t\tLOCATION\n");
01264               fprintf (stderr,
01265                        "----\t----\t------\t--------\t-----\t\t--------\n");
01266               count = 1;
01267             }
01268           if (vreg->pvreg)
01269             fprintf (stderr, "%d(%d)\t%s\t",
01270                      vreg->index, vreg->pvreg->index, BANK_NAME (vreg->type));
01271           else
01272             fprintf (stderr, "%d\t%s\t", vreg->index, BANK_NAME (vreg->type));
01273 
01274           if (vreg->flags & R_SPILLED)
01275             fprintf (stderr, "  SP\t%d\t\t%s\t\tmem[%d]\n",
01276                      vreg->phys_reg, CLASS_NAME (vreg->rclass),
01277                      vreg->spill_loc);
01278           else
01279             fprintf (stderr, "  A\t%d(%d)\t\t%s\n", vreg->phys_reg,
01280                      vreg->base_index, CLASS_NAME (vreg->rclass));
01281 
01282           count++;
01283         }
01284     }
01285 
01286   /* Obtain the ranges of the rotating registers, or return the empty
01287      set of there are none for this function. */
01288 
01289   if ((rr_attr = L_find_attr (L_fn->attr, "rr")))
01290     {
01291       if (int_base < 0)
01292         rr_attr->field[0]->value.i = -int_base;
01293       if (flt_base < 0)
01294         rr_attr->field[2]->value.i = -flt_base;
01295       if (dbl_base < 0)
01296         rr_attr->field[4]->value.i = -dbl_base;
01297       if (pred_base < 0)
01298         rr_attr->field[6]->value.i = -pred_base;
01299     }
01300 }
01301 
01302 
01303 int
01304 R_get_rot_reg_alloc_multiple (int ctype)
01305 {
01306   int rtype = R_Ltype_to_Rtype (ctype);
01307 
01308   R_Physical_Bank *reg_bank = R_bank + rtype + R_CALLER;
01309 
01310   if (reg_bank->num_rot_reg > 0)
01311     return reg_bank->num_rot_reg_alloc;
01312 
01313   reg_bank = R_bank + rtype + R_CALLEE;
01314 
01315   if (reg_bank->num_rot_reg > 0)
01316     return reg_bank->num_rot_reg_alloc;
01317 
01318   return -1;
01319 }
01320 
01321 
01322 int
01323 R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (int ctype)
01324 {
01325   int rtype = R_Ltype_to_Rtype (ctype);
01326 
01327   R_Physical_Bank *reg_bank = R_bank + rtype + R_CALLER;
01328 
01329   if (reg_bank->num_rot_reg > 0)
01330     return reg_bank->num_rot_reg;
01331 
01332   reg_bank = R_bank + rtype + R_CALLEE;
01333 
01334   if (reg_bank->num_rot_reg > 0)
01335     return reg_bank->num_rot_reg;
01336 
01337   return 0;
01338 }
